{"summary": "Write regression tests for interactive shorthand parsing in session mode, covering slash-command normalization, interactive rewriting, and session turn handling.", "project": {"language": "python"}, "files": [{"path": "tests/test_session_shorthand.py", "content": """"Regression tests for interactive shorthand parsing in session mode."""

from __future__ import annotations

import importlib.util
import sys
from pathlib import Path


def _load_cli_module():
    root = Path(__file__).resolve().parents[1]
    cli_path = root / "scripts" / "elephant_cli.py"
    spec = importlib.util.spec_from_file_location("elephant_cli_local", cli_path)
    if spec is None or spec.loader is None:
        raise RuntimeError("Unable to load scripts/elephant_cli.py")
    module = importlib.util.module_from_spec(spec)
    sys.modules[spec.name] = module
    spec.loader.exec_module(module)
    return module


elephant_cli = _load_cli_module()


def test_rewrite_interactive_command_parts_preserves_plain_text():
    """Plain text lines are returned unchanged."""
    parts = ["hello", "world"]
    assert elephant_cli._rewrite_interactive_command_parts(parts) == parts


def test_rewrite_interactive_command_parts_normalizes_slash_commands():
    """Lines starting with / are rewritten to argparse command names."""
    parts = ["/plan", "--task", "add feature"]
    rewritten = elephant_cli._rewrite_interactive_command_parts(parts)
    assert rewritten[0] == "plan"
    assert rewritten[1:] == ["--task", "add feature"]


def test_rewrite_interactive_command_parts_handles_mixed_content():
    """Mixed plain text and slash commands are rewritten correctly."""
    parts = ["/plan", "--task", "add feature", "next turn", "/code", "--dry-run"]
    rewritten = elephant_cli._rewrite_interactive_command_parts(parts)
    assert rewritten == ["plan", "--task", "add feature", "next turn", "code", "--dry-run"]


def test_rewrite_interactive_command_parts_handles_empty_input():
    """Empty input returns empty list."""
    assert elephant_cli._rewrite_interactive_command_parts([]) == []


def test_run_session_parses_shorthand_and_invokes_command(tmp_path: Path, monkeypatch):
    """Session mode correctly parses shorthand and routes to command handlers."""
    (tmp_path / "pyproject.toml").write_text("[project]\nname='tmp'\n", encoding="utf-8")
    monkeypatch.setenv("ELEPHANT_PROJECT_ROOT", str(tmp_path))

    parser = elephant_cli._build_parser()

    # Simulate session shorthand input
    argv = ["session", "--cwd", str(tmp_path)]
    args = parser.parse_args(argv)

    # Verify session command is recognized
    assert args.command == "session"


def test_print_session_turn_formats_response(tmp_path: Path, monkeypatch, capsys):
    """Session turn output is formatted correctly."""
    (tmp_path / "pyproject.toml").write_text("[project]\nname='tmp'\n", encoding="utf-8")
    monkeypatch.setenv("ELEPHANT_PROJECT_ROOT", str(tmp_path))

    response = {
        "ok": True,
        "command": "/plan",
        "data": {
            "plan_steps": ["Step 1", "Step 2"],
            "cot_steps": ["Thought 1", "Thought 2"],
        },
        "metrics": {"latency_ms": 100},
    }

    elephant_cli._print_session_turn(response)
    captured = capsys.readouterr()
    assert "PLAN" in captured.out
    assert "Thought 1" in captured.out
    assert "Step 1" in captured.out


def test_append_session_event_writes_events(tmp_path: Path, monkeypatch):
    """Session events are appended to the session log."""
    (tmp_path / "pyproject.toml").write_text("[project]\nname='tmp'\n", encoding="utf-8")
    monkeypatch.setenv("ELEPHANT_PROJECT_ROOT", str(tmp_path))

    session_id = "test_session_123"
    elephant_cli._append_session_event(tmp_path, session_id, "user", "hello")
    elephant_cli._append_session_event(tmp_path, session_id, "assistant", "hi there")

    log_path = tmp_path / ".elephant-coder" / "sessions" / f"{session_id}.jsonl"
    assert log_path.exists()
    lines = log_path.read_text(encoding="utf-8").strip().split("\n")
    assert len(lines) == 2
    import json
    assert json.loads(lines[0])["role"] == "user"
    assert json.loads(lines[1])["role"] == "assistant"


def test_load_session_context_reconstructs_history(tmp_path: Path, monkeypatch):
    """Session context loads event history correctly."""
    (tmp_path / "pyproject.toml").write_text("[project]\nname='tmp'\n", encoding="utf-8")
    monkeypatch.setenv("ELEPHANT_PROJECT_ROOT", str(tmp_path))

    session_id = "test_session_456"
    elephant_cli._append_session_event(tmp_path, session_id, "user", "first")
    elephant_cli._append_session_event(tmp_path, session_id, "assistant", "second")

    prompt, history = elephant_cli._load_session_context(tmp_path, session_id)
    assert prompt == ""
    assert len(history) == 2
    assert history[0]["role"] == "user"
    assert history[0]["content"] == "first"
    assert history[1]["role"] == "assistant"
    assert history[1]["content"] == "second"


def test_session_mode_handles_empty_history(tmp_path: Path, monkeypatch):
    """Session mode gracefully handles missing history."""
    (tmp_path / "pyproject.toml").write_text("[project]\nname='tmp'\n", encoding="utf-8")
    monkeypatch.setenv("ELEPHANT_PROJECT_ROOT", str(tmp_path))

    prompt, history = elephant_cli._load_session_context(tmp_path, "nonexistent_session")
    assert prompt == ""
    assert history == []
"}], "dependencies": {"dependencies": {}, "devDependencies": {}, "python": [], "pythonDev": ["pytest"], "rust": [], "go": [], "cpp": []}, "commands": ["pytest tests/test_session_shorthand.py -v"]}
